availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer. Native of County Cork, Ireland. Married to Elizabeth Bell Tatton on September 7, 1853. Father of Mary E. Tatton and William Tatton. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860. Served in the 18th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Corporal from October 26, 1861 to November 12, 1982. Captured at Richmond, Kentucky August 30, 1862, released with Surgeons certificate November 12, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, Film # 272800, p.1853-1
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 538
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 318 and 489.
